1.name: Computer
1.definition: A computer is an electronic device used around the world that can store and process information and perform different tasks

2.name: Compute
2.definition: Is a verb that refers to the act of performing math or logic calculations using a computer or any computing device

3.name: Hardware
3.definition: The hardware reffers to the components from the computer that you can touch

4.name: Software
4.definition: Are those components of the computer that you cannot touch such as the operating system, programs, etc

5.name: Optical Character Recognition
5.definition: Technology used to converted documents that have been scanned or photograph into editable documents

6.name: Network
6.definition: Devices that are connected to each other and can share resources with each other

7.name: Internet vs Intranet
7.definition: Internet is the global network that connect and comunicate computers worldwide, while an Intranet is a private network that shares information only among the members

8.name: Search Engine
8.definition: Is a program or web site that allows users to search for information on the internet such as Google

9.name: Browser
9.definition: Is a software application used to acces and view website such as Safari or Google Chrome

10.name: Agile Software Development
10.definition: Is an iterative and flexible approach to software development that emphasizes collaboration, adaptability and delivering working software in short iterations

11.name: API (application programming interface)
11.definition: Set of rules and protocoles that allows different software applications to communicate and interact with each other

12.name: Cache
12.definition: Stores different access data for quick retrieval

13.name: Scrum
13.definition: Agile project managment framework that promotes collaboration, flexibility and iterative development. It divides work into small and more managable tasks called sprints

14.name: JavaScript
14.definition: Is a programming language used for developing interactive web pages and web applications

15.name: HTML(Hypertext Markup Language)
15.definition: Standard markup language used for creating the structure and content of web pages

16.name: CSS(Cascading Style Sheets)
16.definition: Language used to describe the presentation, appearance  and visual aspects of HTML elements on a web page.

17.name: React
17.definition: JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create reusable UI components and efficiently manage the state and rendering of the application.

18.name: React Native
18.definition: Framework or building mobile applications using JavaScript and React. It allows developers to write code once and deploy it on multiple platforms, such as iOS and Android.

19.name: AWS (Amazon Web Services)
19.definition: Cloud computing platform provided by Amazon that offers various services and tools for storage, computing power, database management, and more.

20.name: MVP (Minimum Viable Product)
20.description: Development strategy that focuses on building a basic version of a product with essential features to gather feedback and validate its viability.

21.name: SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle)
21.definition: Structured approach to software development that consists of several phases, including requirements gathering, design, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance.

22.name: Sprints
22.definition: Short periods in agile software development where a team focuses on delivering specific tasks.

23.name: Web3
23.definition: 'The next generation of internet', it aims to create decentralized web experience using blockchain, cryptocurrencies and peer-to-peer technology.

24.name: Blockchain
24.definition: Decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across multiple computers. It is supposed to provide transparency, security, and immutability for various applications, including cryptocurrencies

25.name: ChatGPT
25.definition: Artificial intelligence model develop by OpenAi

26.name: Additional computer terms 1
26.definition: MVC,Algorithm,Data Structure,Conditional Statement, Database, Endpoints, Front-End, Back-End, Framework, Library,Debugging, Version Control,Responsive Design

27.name: Additional computer terms 2
27.definition: Variable, Loop, Function,Object-Oriented Programming, Testing, Agile Methodologies,Mobile App Development,Cross-platform Development,Cybersecurity,Cloud Computing,Machine Learning,AI
